other_tests.findings: Initial fracture alignment assessed with acceptable plain anteroposterior and lateral radiographs; healing with some broken screws noted.
other_tests.changes_over_time: One patient developed deep infection; another had nonunion without recurrence of infection after fourteen months. Additional surgeries were not planned due to comorbidities.

other_tests.date: Six to ten weeks after initial fixation
other_tests.findings: Cultures of intraoperative specimens were negative, hardware appeared stable.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Fracture appeared healed radiographically eighteen months postoperatively; patient returned to work.

other_tests.procedure_name: Revision open reduction and internal fixation
other_tests.findings: Fracture of one of the locking screws at screw-plate interface and impending fatigue failure of plate.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Nonunion healed after four months; knee function improved significantly over the following months.
